ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My abilities and confidence with speaking and reading Spanish definitely improved. I now feel much more comfortable trying to speak more complex thoughts, even if I know they won't be quite correct.
i developed my spanish speaking skills
spanish conversational skills, reading skills, vocabulary and tenses
I developed an introductory understanding of Spanish, got much better at Spanish grammar, learned cultural information and became more comfortable public speaking in the language.
I gained a greater insight to Spanish culture and language.

I deepened my grammar significantly. Whether it be applying the future tense or differentiating between the imperfect and the preterite, I feel that my grammar/conjugation has improved significantly. I also learned a lot of new things about Spanish speaking countries and the cultures attributed to them.

I learned a lot about what I would say are the most essential and commonly used tenses from the language from preterite to subjunctive. I also learned a good amount of vocabulary about useful topics. I became more comfortable with using the language, especially in speaking and listening to it with the immersion we have in class. Learning about the culture was also very interesting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I thought the class was very well designed. Classes were challenging but a lot of fun, and we had a good variety of activities and assessments. 

Weaknesses: For the first month or two, it felt like we had too many things due each week for me to be really absorbing the material. The pace in the second half of the course was more conducive to learning thoroughly.

Strengths: small classes; one online day; different types of activities
Weaknesses: exams are weighted too much; homework material should not cost money.
The course is a well-oiled machine. It's a lot of work, but if you do it all you'll feel at least somewhat on top of everything.

There are three exams in this course. I felt that the unit tests covered too much material at once. It may be better to have more exams over less content. There was also a lot of memorization with this course. I think time could have been better spent on other activities.

Strengths: emphasis on extemporaneous speaking and in class activities which helped solidify my understanding of the material.

Weaknesses: maybe more in class conversations
More in class lessons of grammar and vocabulary. Worksheets are not as engaging as lecturing with the professor.

Strengths are that the class is very well organized, the detailed textbook is followed well, the in-class activities are enjoyable and engaging. However, I wish we spent more time reviewing the grammar concepts in-class. The grading is very unforgiving, but many different activities and exams compose the grade, so having a weakness in one area doesn't hurt your overall grade too much.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn Spanish!
yes if you want to learn spanish
Yes if u want to learn spanish

I would recommend it if you're willing to put many hours a week into all of the homework. You can't just do the SuperSite - you also have to independently study the grammar and vocab, because there's a lot of it.
Yes. I thought the professor was very knowledgable and grading was fair, with clear rubrics for assignments.
I would recommend this course if you are looking to improve your oral proficiency and general grammatical/conjugation knowledge.

Many students taking this course are likely doing it for the language requirement, but I would still recommend this course. The course itself and the daily homework can be very time-consuming, but it's very well-organized. Garcia is a very nice professor, makes the class fun and engaging, and is great at helping you understand the grammar concepts.
